New Records: Shohei Ohtani became the first player in MLB history to record a 50-50 season, breaking the record for the most home runs and stolen bases in a single season.
Shohei Ohtani set a new franchise record for the Los Angeles Dodgers with his 51st home run of the season.
Key Match Events: Shohei Ohtani hit three home runs and went 6-for-6 with 10 RBIs in a single game against the Miami Marlins.
Shohei Ohtani received a standing ovation from the fans in Miami after hitting his 50th home run.
The Los Angeles Dodgers clinched a playoff berth with their victory against the Miami Marlins.
Post-Match Reflections: Shohei Ohtani expressed relief at finally achieving the 50-50 milestone.
Los Angeles Dodgers manager Skip Schumaker acknowledged the Marlins' decision to pitch to Ohtani and admitted it was a strategic mistake.
Miscellaneous Highlights: Shohei Ohtani's performance was compared to historical players who achieved similar milestones.
Shohei Ohtani's historic season highlighted his versatility and impact on the Dodgers' playoff chances.
